moves.1. e3 e5 2. d4 exd4 3. exd4 d5 4. c3 Bd6: If there's an exchange of Knights I won't mind... at least h7 won't be under so much pressure.
moves.10. h4 Qf6:
I really want White to retreat his Knight.
I could have threatened it with h6, but he might have just ignored the threat... taking the Knight would open the h-File for White's Rook.
Now I'm threatening a Knight Fork with Nxf2.
moves.11. f3 Nxg5:
I was hoping to attack but I think I've got too many threats lined up on h7.
After 12. hxg5/Bxg5 I'll play 12. ... Qg6
moves.12. Bxg5 Qg6 13. Qxg6 fxg6:
I don't want to open the h-File for White.
I'm considering ... Bf5.
moves.14. Kf1 Nd7 15. Nd2 Nf6 16. Rg1 h6:
White is forced to take my Knight now, unless they want to throw away their DSB.
It doesn't do me that much good...
... What I really want to do is put some pressure on White's LSB.
moves.17. Bxf6 gxf6 18. Re1 h5 19. Bd3 Bf5:
I'd like to put my DSB on g3 and cover it with f4 to cramp White's g-Rook.
I didn't see the slim chance of getting a Mate until seeing 21. Rxe8+ Rxe8:
with my Bishop on g3 mu opponent might miss Re1#.
moves.20. Bxf5 gxf5 21. Rxe8+ Rxe8: If I had my DSB on g3 there's actually a potential Mate with Re1#.
moves.22. g3 Kh7 23. f4 c5 24. Nb3 cxd4 25. Nx: I'm a bit uncomfortable with how far White's b-Pawn is...
I think a Draw might be the best I can get here...
